admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Road Maintenance Project for Laos
            promotes the sustainable preservation of the national road
            network (NRN) through the development and implementation of
            financing and management maintenance systems; and designs
            and tests, in four selected provinces, financing and
            management systems for the sustainable maintenance of the
            local road network (LRN). There are eight project
            components. The first component finances periodic
            maintenance works on various maintainable sections of the
            NRN and LRN. The second component finances routine emergency
            works. The third component supports a strategy to reduce
            overloading on the road network and provides works, weighing
            equipment and specialized services that promote policy
            reforms, partnership between the government and the
            transport industry, and capacity building. The fourth
            component completes the establishment of the road management
            system. The fifth component consists of providing
            specialized consultants that will assist the Road
            Maintenance Advisory Board and its Secretariat in carrying
            out their activities. The sixth component develops
            institutional capacity to manage projects by improving
            project preparation, execution, and monitoring, and by
            developing a strategy to improve the performance of the
            local contracting and consulting industry. The eighth
            component fosters the involvement of road users and
            beneficiaries in delivering and managing road maintenance activities.
